title: Viscous hydrodynamics of excitons in van der Waals heterostructures
abstract:
Excitons in semiconductors can form a variety of collective states leading to
different regimes of exciton propagation. Here we theoretically demonstrate the
possibility to reach the viscous hydrodynamic -- liquid-like -- regime of
exciton propagation in two-dimensional materials, focusing on the mono- and
bi-layers of transition metal dichalcogenides. This regime can be realized
where the exciton-exciton collisions dominate over exciton-phonon and disorder
scattering. We have derived the hydrodynamic-like set of equations describing
viscous flow of interacting excitons based on the Boltzmann kinetic equation
for the exciton distribution function. A comparison of various exciton
propagation regimes including diffusive, viscous hydrodynamic, and superfluid
regime is presented. Conditions which allow one to observe the hydrodynamic
regime of exciton transport, and the role of material are discussed.
